content.user_title: Build Payload CMS applications with TypeScript
content.value_statement: Payload CMS development requires understanding collections, fields, hooks, and access control patterns. This skill provides complete reference documentation for building secure, scalable CMS applications.
actual_capabilities: Provides complete field type reference with validation and admin options
Documents access control patterns for collections and fields
Explains hook lifecycle and context patterns
Covers database adapters and transaction handling
Includes query operators for Local API, REST, and GraphQL
Guides plugin development with TypeScript patterns
limitations: Does not execute code or interact with Payload instances
Cannot generate types or run migrations automatically
Does not provide real-time debugging or error analysis
Reference documentation only, not a code generator

output_examples.input: How do I set up role-based access control?
output: Add a roles field with select type and hasMany option to your Users collection
Set saveToJWT: true on the roles field for access without database queries
Create access control functions that check user.roles.includes for specific roles
Apply access functions to collection operations like create, read, update, delete

best_practices: Always pass the req parameter in hooks to maintain transaction atomicity
Set overrideAccess: false when passing a user to Local API operations
Use context flags to prevent infinite hook loops when updating documents
anti_patterns: Passing user parameter to Local API without overrideAccess: false bypasses permissions
Performing nested operations in hooks without req breaks transaction atomicity
Using afterChange hooks that trigger the same collection update causes infinite loops

faq.question: Which databases does Payload support?
faq.answer: Payload supports MongoDB, PostgreSQL, and SQLite through official database adapters. Each adapter requires specific configuration.

faq.question: What is the maximum query depth for relationships?
faq.answer: Default depth is 2. Set maxDepth on relationship fields or depth parameter in queries to control population levels.

faq.question: How do I integrate Payload with existing Next.js apps?
faq.answer: Payload installs directly in your Next.js app folder. Import getPayload and your config to access the Local API.

faq.question: Does this skill store or access my project data?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides reference documentation only. It does not execute code or access your files or databases.

faq.question: Why does my access control not work in Local API?
faq.answer: Local API bypasses access control by default. Set overrideAccess: false when passing a user parameter.

faq.question: How does this compare to reading Payload docs directly?
faq.answer: This skill condenses official documentation into patterns and examples optimized for AI assistance and quick reference.
